title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 86.2 - Shellfishing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 86.2 - Shellfishing

State Regulations

Shellfishing has been reserved by the Town of Brookhaven
for citizen-residents only and subject to the following restrictions: (a) A permit from the town must be obtained
to take in excess of one-half bushel of shellfish per person per day. (b) The use of a dredge is
prohibited. (c) No shellfishing is
permitted on Sundays. (d) Oysters
may not be taken from May 1 to September 1 inclusive, and shall be in excess of
five inches in length. (e) Hard
clams shall be not less than one inch in thickness. (f) Soft shell clams shall be not less than
two inches in length. This section in no way suspends or negates any other
existing State or town regulation pertaining to the taking of
shellfish. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6

86.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
